meanings.definition: The policy of protecting the interests of native-born or established inhabitants against those of immigrants.
meanings.sent1: Nativism can sometimes lead to tensions between different groups of people.
meanings.sent2: The government's nativism aims to prioritize the needs of local residents over newcomers.
meanings.sent3: In a humorous twist, the nativism debate at the town hall meeting turned into a heated argument about who had the best pie recipe.
meanings.sent4: The nativism of the town's residents was like a fortress protecting their way of life.
meanings.sent5: The nativism of the community was so strong that even the birds seemed to chirp in the local dialect.

meanings.definition: The belief that native customs, beliefs, or values are superior to those of other cultures.
meanings.sent1: Some people's nativism makes them resistant to trying new foods from different cultures.
meanings.sent2: Her nativism made her proud of her heritage and traditions.
meanings.sent3: The nativism of the group was evident when they insisted on celebrating only traditional holidays.
meanings.sent4: His nativism was like a shield protecting his cultural identity from outside influences.
meanings.sent5: The nativism of the village was so strong that even the wind carried the scent of their traditional spices.
